quizDescription: Test your knowledge about the game of golf and its history!

questions.question: In which country did golf originate?
questions.explanation: Golf originated in Scotland, and the first official golf rules were written in Edinburgh in 1744.

questions.question: What is the term for a hole completed in one stroke under par on a golf course?
questions.explanation: A 'Hole-in-One' is the term used in golf for completing a hole with just one stroke under par, achieving it in a single shot.

questions.question: Which golf tournament is considered one of the four major championships in professional golf?
questions.explanation: The Masters is one of the four major championships in professional golf and is held annually at Augusta National Golf Club in Georgia, USA.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of clubs that a golfer is allowed to carry in their bag during a round of golf?
questions.explanation: A golfer is allowed to carry a maximum of 14 clubs in their bag during a round of golf, as per the official rules of golf.

questions.question: Which golfer holds the record for the most major championships won in men's golf?
questions.explanation: Jack Nicklaus holds the record for the most major championships won in men's golf, with 18 major titles to his name.

questions.question: What is the term used for a score of one stroke over par on a golf hole?
questions.explanation: A 'Bogey' is the term used in golf for a score of one stroke over par on a hole.

questions.question: Which golf course is famously known as 'The Home of Golf'?
questions.explanation: St. Andrews Links, located in Scotland, is famously known as 'The Home of Golf' and is one of the oldest and most prestigious golf courses in the world.

questions.question: Which golf tournament is played annually at TPC Sawgrass in Florida, featuring the iconic island green at the 17th hole?
questions.explanation: The Players Championship is an annual golf tournament played at TPC Sawgrass in Florida, and it is often referred to as the 'Fifth Major' in professional golf.

questions.question: Which golfer is often referred to as 'The Golden Bear' and is considered one of the greatest golfers of all time?
questions.explanation: Jack Nicklaus, also known as 'The Golden Bear,' is considered one of the greatest golfers of all time, with a record 18 major championship victories.

questions.question: Which golfer has won the most Masters Tournaments (The Masters) in professional golf history?
questions.explanation: Jack Nicklaus holds the record for the most Masters Tournament victories (The Masters) in professional golf history, with six green jackets.
